issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The elapsed time filter on the jobhistory server filters incorrect information. 
For e.g. on a cluster where the elapsed time of all the tasks is either 7 or 8sec, the filter displays non null table entries for 1sec or 3sec
fields.summary: Elapsed time filter on jobhistory server displays incorrect table entries

comments.body: The issue exists not just for elapsed time but also for elapsed time shuffle, elapsed time merge and elapsed time reduce.

I think what's going on here is that the filter on time is searching on both the text data of the cell as well as title. I think the intention is to sort by hidden element title and filter based on text data of the cell.
This patch removes sorting/filter by title except for task id. Now they are sorted by cell text data
looks like it needs to be sorted numerically, but just on seconds, not on milliseconds
This issue exists on many of the web pages that display elapsed time

  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12504073/MAPREDUCE-3045.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

No new tests are needed for this change as it only changes html output.

Manual tests include testing that tables are sorted correctly and that filter and search terms return correct results for all tables that have an elapsed time column.

This will still end up being an issue for long running jobs. The displayed time will contain 'hrs', 'mins' and 'sec' - and the 'title' value will always be in seconds. Is there some way to prevent the 'title' being part of the search ? (The search on the name field in the TasksPage is also broken - due to the link being part of the search)
Good point, Sid. Despite many tries, I have not found a way to separate the sort and search. I will post a question to the datatables forum and see if that turns up any results.
Canceling patch to address issues

Solution was more fundamental than I supposed.

Solution was found here.
http://datatables.net/development/filtering
As before only manual tests were performed due to the nature of this fix.
